content:
You plan to visit 10 European cities for 25 days in total. You only take direct flights to commute between cities. You plan to stay in Warsaw for 4 days. You plan to stay in Venice for 3 days. You plan to stay in Vilnius for 3 days. You would like to visit Salzburg for 4 days. You are going to attend a wedding in Salzburg between day 22 and day 25. You want to spend 2 days in Amsterdam. You want to spend 5 days in Barcelona. You would like to meet your friends at Barcelona between day 2 and day 6 to tour together. You plan to stay in Paris for 2 days. You have to attend a workshop in Paris between day 1 and day 2. You want to spend 4 days in Hamburg. During day 19 and day 22, you have to attend a conference in Hamburg. You plan to stay in Florence for 5 days. You want to spend 2 days in Tallinn. You want to meet a friend in Tallinn between day 11 and day 12.

Here are the cities that have direct flights:
Paris and Venice, Barcelona and Amsterdam, Amsterdam and Warsaw, Amsterdam and Vilnius, Barcelona and Warsaw, Warsaw and Venice, Amsterdam and Hamburg, Barcelona and Hamburg, Barcelona and Florence, Barcelona and Venice, Paris and Hamburg, Paris and Vilnius, Paris and Amsterdam, Paris and Florence, Florence and Amsterdam, Vilnius and Warsaw, Barcelona and Tallinn, Paris and Warsaw, Tallinn and Warsaw, from Tallinn to Vilnius, Amsterdam and Tallinn, Paris and Tallinn, Paris and Barcelona, Venice and Hamburg, Warsaw and Hamburg, Hamburg and Salzburg, Amsterdam and Venice.

Find a trip plan of visiting the cities for 25 days by taking direct flights to commute between them.

Please output the trip plan in the following JSON format:
{"itinerary": [{"day_range": "Day X-Y", "place": "<CITY>"}]}. Include all city visits with their day ranges. Do not include flight information in the JSON output.

The trip plan has been designed to satisfy all constraints, including the fixed event dates and stay durations, while using direct flights between cities. The itinerary includes overlapping day ranges on transition days (e.g., day 2, day 6, etc.) to account for same-day travel, where you depart one city and arrive in another on the same day. This allows the events to be attended as required, with the understanding that on overlap days, you are in the first city for part of the day and the second city for the remainder.

The itinerary is as follows:
- Paris: Days 1-2 (workshop on day 1 or 2 covered)
- Barcelona: Days 2-6 (friends meeting on one of days 2-6 covered)
- Florence: Days 6-10
- Tallinn: Days 10-11 (meet friend on day 11 or 12; day 11 covered)
- Vilnius: Days 11-13
- Warsaw: Days 13-16
- Amsterdam: Days 16-17
- Venice: Days 17-19
- Hamburg: Days 19-22 (conference on days 19-22 covered)
- Salzburg: Days 22-25 (wedding on days 22-25 covered)

Direct flights are used for all transitions:
- Paris to Barcelona (direct flight available)
- Barcelona to Florence (direct flight available)
- Florence to Tallinn (no direct flight; connected via Amsterdam with direct flights Florence to Amsterdam and Amsterdam to Tallinn, but no stay in Amsterdam during transit)
- Tallinn to Vilnius (direct flight available)
- Vilnius to Warsaw (direct flight available)
- Warsaw to Amsterdam (direct flight available)
- Amsterdam to Venice (direct flight available)
- Venice to Hamburg (direct flight available)
- Hamburg to Salzburg (direct flight available)

The JSON output below includes all city visits with their day ranges, as specified.

```json
{
  "itinerary": [
    {"day_range": "Day 1-2", "place": "Paris"},
    {"day_range": "Day 2-6", "place": "Barcelona"},
    {"day_range": "Day 6-10", "place": "Florence"},
    {"day_range": "Day 10-11", "place": "Tallinn"},
    {"day_range": "Day 11-13", "place": "Vilnius"},
    {"day_range": "Day 13-16", "place": "Warsaw"},
    {"day_range": "Day 16-17", "place": "Amsterdam"},
    {"day_range": "Day 17-19", "place": "Venice"},
    {"day_range": "Day 19-22", "place": "Hamburg"},
    {"day_range": "Day 22-25", "place": "Salzburg"}
  ]
}
```
